Legal_Issue: Whether the Member of the Immigration and Refugee Board erred in rejecting the Applicants' claim for refugee status and protection
Application_Facts: The delay in leaving Italy was reasonable given Sida's need to confirm suspicions and organize his family
Applicants claimed refugee status based on perceived political persecution
Court_Ruling: Application granted, case remitted for reconsideration
Grounds_for_Claim: Errors in law and fact by the Board
Applicable_Legislation: Section 97 of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Application_Basis: Refugee protection due to political persecution
Evidence_Assessed: Political situation in country of origin
Relief_Sought: Granting of refugee status and protection
Governing_Rule: Separate consideration of country conditions required under Section 97
Evidentiary_Deficiency: Failure to properly consider country conditions
Outcome: Case returned to the Board for reevaluation
Harm_Assessment: Risk of persecution in country of origin
Cause_Description: Applicants claimed refugee status based on perceived political persecution but were denied by the Board
Evidence_Handling: Country conditions dismissed improperly due to credibility findings
Legal_Provision_Violated: Section 97 of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Evidence_Issues: Inadequate assessment of objective risk despite available evidence on country conditions
Residency_Compliance: Delay in leaving Italy assessed as reasonable
Decision_Rationale: Error in conflating subjective credibility with objective country conditions analysis
Evidentiary_Issues: Failure to separately evaluate country conditions
